name: European Covenant on Demographic Change
memberOrga: The Association counts 164 member organisations; The full list is available at http://www.agefriendlyeurope.org/the-covenant
goal:
The main objective of the European Covenant on Demographic Change is to help the European Union to better respond to demographic change by allowing local, regional and national authorities and other stakeholders - who wish to work together to promote innovative solutions to adapt the living and working environments to the needs of the ageing population in Europe - to improve life expectancy in good health, create an inclusive society for all ages, and create new synergies between interested stakeholders and governance levels.
It aims in particular to:
- enable cities and regions in Europe to commit to develop, implement and monitor measures reflecting the principles underlying the "Age-Friendly Cities and Communities" programme of the World Health Organization as an answer to the demographic challenges they face;
- promote networking among its members; and
- build synergies with existing initiatives such as the WHO Global Network of Age-Friendly Cities and Communities, the WHO European Healthy Cities Network, the 2013 Dublin Declaration on age-friendly Cities and the European Innovation Partnership on Active and Healthy Ageing.
The Association is composed of local, regional or national public authorities, civil society organisations, research centres, universities, companies and other stakeholders.

The Association maintains all necessary relationships to promote its objectives in particular with the European Union institutions, the WHO and any other institution or organisation which share its objectives.
The Association is an official affiliate programme of the WHO network of Age-friendly cities and communities.
interests: Digital economy and society, Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Transport
